comment: Dirnberger's class is a bit of work but overall an easy A. There were 10 short quizzes, 3 exams, 3 discussions with replies, Mastering Activities, a final, and ungraded labs. He drops the 2 lowest quizzes and lowest exam. Every quiz and exam was proctored, but if you watch his lecture vids and read the lab assignments you'll do great. Great class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: He is a sweet professor but his class is TERRIBLE! You have to read and watch lectures, read the textbook, read the labs (that are sometimes 6 pages long) and then takes quizzes. BUT you dont have to turn in the labs but if you dont read them you wont do well on the quizzes. Its way too much for a 1101 class. I dropped it before the 15week mark
Questions are difficult to understand and Likes to trick students with multiple answers.

He gives quizzes every week on lockdown browser, and there is a LOT of information you need to study. The quizzes are also hard. He drops 2 lowest quizzes and 1 lowest test. I wish I had taken Ashley Green for this class instead of him. If you want to take this class for gen ed, skip him. This will be your hardest class and you'll have to WORK.

This class is straight forward & he gives you all you need to be successful. 3 units, each consisting of 3 modules. Each module has lecture videos, textbook reading, a lab, & a quiz based on those 3 things. One discussion & exam per unit. He drops 2 quizzes & 1 test grade, & for each quiz or test he gives a study guide. Do the work and you're fine!

Let me be clear - this professor's quizzes are strangely worded and confusing. Taken online, a majority of the students had difficulty understanding the questions and choosing the actual answer. Graded primarily on 3-4 discussion, 3 exams and a final. 2 quizzes and 1 exam dropped. 1 extra credit opportunity. Take at your own risk.

In the beginning this class was hard, but a few weeks in he began uploading study guides for all quizzes and tests. These are the only thing that helped me get through this class. Also, READ the Online Labs. They are usually quite long but you do NOT actually have to complete them, you will only be asked what they were about on the quiz/tests.

Course: Freshwater Ecology. Dr. Dirnberger is nice and wants all of his students to succeed and go to Belize. ATTENDance-not mandatory BUT only outline is posted. notes come from lecture, and you might miss participation or group activity points. Lab reports are the most time consuming and challenging part of this course. Exams straight forward.

Took Dr. D for ecology lab, he gets super into the material, it's clear he is very passionate about ecology. He understands though that its not everyone's thing and does well to get you through the lab. Very accessible, willing to answer questions. His grading is a little weird sometimes, just ask abt things you don't understand and you'll be fine
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I took Dr. Dirnberger for marine bio in belize and he was great!! gave good lectures and made information very easy to understand. also a lot of fun to travel with. grades fairly. I definitely recommend!

Dr. D loves ecology, its obvious. He tried to make labs fun and interesting and he is very helpful (gives you the hypothesis/hints for writing lab reports). His directions are clear and gives good feedback on papers. Would definitely take again. Very nice guy.

Dr. Dirnberger is a great professor. He expects a lot from his students. He is lots of fun in class and on field trips. The lab reports are intense, but he will give you help if you ask. There is not a book, so if you miss lecture you are lost. The field work is very cool and you do learn a lot in this class.
Dr. Dirnberger is a great professor. He is very approachable. He is willing to help. This class requires work, like any lab does. There are no exams. Various lab reports with lots of analysis.

Great professor.  Always willing to help you out or answer any question. Very passionate about what he teaches. Tests come straight from the notes. Lab portion is easy, he doesn't take off much as long as you follow the basic directions.
LOVED this class, only took it in the beging for an extra upper division biology course but I ended up loving it! Awsome professor who can make any biology topic interesting.

Dr. D is incredibly awesome and hilarious. Invertebrates will become interesting to you. Go to class, don't wait until the last minute to study, don't buy the book, and have FUN in lab. Oh, and watching videos is awesome.
He was great. He focused on real life concepts.

Dr. D made class fun and was extremely helpful.  Tests were mainly multiple choice with a few short answer and matching.  Note outlines are provided and study outlines narrow your focus for tests.  He gives students a fair shot at making the grade they are willing to work for.
This was the easiest class of my life. Made a 97 with no sweat. He loves fungi because he is a fun guy! I wish he taught everything.

Very good teacher! Willing to work with students and take additional, personal time away to help! Tells you what you need to know for future classes and the tests/finals are fair game b/c they are all from notes!!!!! study guides provided!

I had him this semester and I really didn't like his teaching techniques. The tests are all from his notes but his notes are only questions and barely any info. I am really good at Biology but the way he thaught the subject made me feel kind of bored about the material. He is very nice and helpful though!
GREAT!! Use the notes and attend class you will do great. makes lessons fun!! I learned A LOT!!
Excellent professor!  Dr. D is very helpful.  Attend class, study your notes, and you will be successful in his class.

He barely marks off on labs.  It's easy to do well in the lab portion.  His lectures are put up on his website.  He answers questions within the notes and puts them on his exams.  Just study his notes and you'll be fine.  He has a VERY dry sense of humor.  I still remember the day he said we're going to learn about fungi because he's a fun guy.
Awesome teacher. Just make sure you go to every class.

The best biology teacher I have had by far. He goes over whats going to be on the tests, and makes sure everyone understands. He makes what would be boring labs fun. I would recommend him to anyone that is going to take this subject.
This man teaches you CONCEPTS, not every single page of the book. Finally, a teacher that gets it!
Fun, easy going prof. Very passionate man

awesome teacher. very nice, very understanding. worked with me when I was really sick, had no problem letting me make stuff up. not hard at all to understand. makes science interesting (which is hard to do, for me)

His tests were difficult because of the way he worded all the questions.  It made it difficult to study the material because you would know something but be tricked by the manner in which it was questioned on the test.
Study his notes. tests are straight off his notes.
Would recomend. Test are on everything he went over in his lectures.
He has alot of great info. to share and he is easy to follow.  His tests include everything he says he will include.
